content: the gov't has no business telling a doctor what he or she can prescribe to a patient. i have colon cancer and did radiation and chemo at the same time. its a real s.o.b. to get through. i have to have surgery and then six months of chemo follow up. if i want to smoke to relieve the side effects i will. lets make congress pee in the bottle then find out how many hypocrits there are!!

title: President Obama Lessens Federal Control On medical marijuana

content: Recently a new drug or a series of drugs made by Bayer from components of Pot that have been isolated has been approved by Canada and most of Europe for very effective treatment of pain, eating disorders and nausea....many in study groups said it was more effective than morphine for pain....yet so far Bayer has been denied trails in the USA because Pot is illegal in any form....write your Congressman Already past the future

title: President Obama Lessens Federal Control On medical marijuana

content: From what I've read, marijuana is cheaper, not addictive, and has less negative side effects than most if not all major prescription painkillers. I think the biggest problem is that pot is cheap so it sort of cuts the drug companies out, no one likes competition. There is no earthly reason why it should not be legal for medicinal purposes.
reply: From what I've read, marijuana is cheaper, not addictive, and has less negative side effects than most if not all major prescription painkillers. I think the biggest problem is that pot is cheap so it sort of cuts the drug companies out, no one likes competition. There is no earthly reason why it should not be legal for medicinal purposes.
title: President Obama Lessens Federal Control On medical marijuana

content: The one thing that is bad about weed is the number of carcinogens and tar in the smoke. But, you do not need to smoke it. You can use a vaporizer. You can boil it with butter to extract the THC (thc clings to the fat in butter), or you can extract concentrated THC. And, THC is effective at treating literally hundreds of afflictions. When I used to live in California I had my cannabis prescription for insomnia and it worked great. I would take 4-5 hits about 30-60 minutes before bedtime and I would be out like a light. Now, that I no longer live in California my only choice is Zolpidem, which is extremely habit forming and has distinct withdrawal symptoms as well as nasty side effects. So, instead I sleep 3-4 hours a day.
